feed.title: Carrie Morris
feed.subtitle: Write an awesome description for your new site here. You can edit this line in _config.yml. It will appear in your document head meta (for Google search results) and in your feed.xml site description.

entry.title: Children United
entry.content:
• Date: June 2016
  • Roles: Illustration, UX, Wireframing, Front-end

Last year at Yoomee I worked on an agile project for Children United, a collaborative between Save the Children and First News, and Achievement for all. They wanted to help connect a global community of educated children to take collective action in order to change their world.
entry.summary: Date: June 2016 Roles: Illustration, UX, Wireframing, Front-end

entry.title: Dragon in the Attic
entry.content:
• Date: June 2016
  • Roles: Character design, Illustration, UX, Storyboarding, Developed in Gamesalad for multi-platform mobile devices and web

Dragon in the Attic is a game aimed at children aged 6-12 designed to encourage them to think about bullying and their health choices through a Character driven concept. The initial concept was created by children for a Schools App Challenge. I was the design lead for this project, working on the character design and game assets and helped to bring their idea into an app with storyboarding, research and development
entry.summary: Date: June 2016 Roles: Character design, Illustration, UX, Storyboarding, Developed in Gamesalad for multi-platform mobile devices and web

entry.title: Healthy Island
entry.content:
• Date: June 2016
  • Roles: Co-creation, Illustration, UX, Storyboarding, Developed in Gamesalad for multi-platform mobile devices and web

Healthy Island is a game aimed at children aged 7-11 encouraging them to think about their health and wellbeing through a series of quizzes and minigames. I helped storyboard the app and led on the UX and design direction

Take a look at Healthy Island Website
entry.summary: Date: June 2016 Roles: Co-creation, Illustration, UX, Storyboarding, Developed in Gamesalad for multi-platform mobile devices and web

entry.title: Young Womens Housing Project (YWHP)
entry.content:
• Date: June 2016
  • Roles: Branding Illustration, UX, Wireframing, Front-end, Wordpress Development

Young Womens Housing Project approached me to help them refresh their brand identity and tell their stories on the web using a CMS platform. I helped them develop their branding to focus on the amazing support work they do with a new lockup, styleguide, website and print materials.

Take a look at Young Womens Housing Project here
“The first thing that made me feel as though our partnership was going to work was that Carrie listened. Really listened to who we were, what we did, why YWHP Sheffield is a really important service and how we are uniquely placed to deliver the support we deliver. This was the bedrock to being able to work at the pace we needed to work at - Carrie was very flexible & patient! – and to provide us with a refreshed branding and website that looks great, says what we need it to say and has given us the confidence to step out and shout about what we do. “ Theresa Wilding, YWHP SA Support Service, Sheffield.
entry.summary: Date: June 2016 Roles: Branding Illustration, UX, Wireframing, Front-end, Wordpress Development
